articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "Civilians of Gaza City, evacuate south for your own safety and the safety of your families," Israel's military told more than 1 million Palestinians in the Gaza Strip's largest city.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Aziz Yaakoubi, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Saudi Arabia is putting U.S.-backed plans to normalise ties with Israel on ice, two sources familiar with Riyadh's thinking said, signalling a rapid rethinking of its foreign policy priorities as war escalates between Israel and Palestinian group Hamas.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia puts Israel deal on ice amid war, engages with Iran, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yarden Roman-Gat handed her three-year-old daughter Geffen to her husband, hoping he could run faster to save her, as they fled while being shot at by Hamas gunmen who attacked a kibbutz in southern Israel on Saturday.
articles.title: Brother determined to find sister missing after kibbutz raid

articles.author: Julia Harte, Steve Gorman
articles.description: U.S. law enforcement agencies escalated security measures on Friday to safeguard Jewish and Muslim communities as protests over the conflict between Israel and Hamas unfolded in a number of cities across the United States and around the world.
articles.title: US law enforcement on high alert for Mideast protests

articles.author: Natalie Grover, Ahmad Ghaddar
articles.description: A war between Islamist group Hamas and Israel poses one of the most significant geopolitical risks to oil markets since Russia's invasion of Ukraine last year.
articles.title: Explainer: What impact can the Israel/Hamas war have on oil?

articles.author: Ari Rabinovitch, John Davison
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Friday that the Pentagon was ready to deploy more military aid to Israel as Israeli forces prepare for a likely invasion of Gaza in response to a devastating attack by militant group Hamas.
articles.title: U.S. ready to send more military aid to Israel, says Austin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah deputy chief Naim Qassem said on Friday that the group would not be swayed by calls for it to stay on the sidelines of the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, saying the party was "fully ready" to contribute to the fighting.
articles.title: Hezbollah says calls for it not to intervene in war 'will have no effect'

articles.author: Henriette Chacar, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Israel's military chief said "Now is the time for war" as his country amassed tanks near the Gaza Strip ahead of a planned ground invasion to annihilate the Palestinian militant Hamas group that rules the enclave and was behind deadly weekend attacks.
articles.title: UN says Israel wants 1.1 million Gazans moved south

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Reuters news videographer has been killed while working in southern Lebanon, Reuters said in a statement on Friday.
articles.title: Reuters videographer killed in southern Lebanon

articles.author: Shashwat Chauhan, Ankika Biswas
articles.description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq fell on Friday, as a decline in megacap stocks overshadowed upbeat quarterly earnings from some of the largest U.S. banks.
articles.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq down as decline in megacaps dulls big banks' shine
